info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 10:45PM CDT until September 21 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Stone and Taney.
* WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1045 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Roark Creek at Expressway Lane and Trigger Creek at Highway J. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Kimberling City, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Merriam Woods, Reeds Spring, Rockaway Beach, Indian Point, Branson West, Shell Knob, Bull Creek, Table Rock, Kirbyville, Coney Island, Cape Fair, Edgewater Beach, Ozark Beach, Table Rock Lake, Lake Taneycomo, Shepherd of the Hills State Park and Table Rock State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT SUNDAY

area.areaDesc: Barry, MO; Stone, MO; Taney, MO
